 I. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עָקֵב‎</span> **noun masculine** ==heel, footprint, hinderpart== (Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***heel***, figurative ***end*** (of a month), <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***mark, sign, trace***; Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎עִקְבָּא‎</span>, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***hell, footprint***, figurative ***trace, mark*** (compare [[Wisdom.2.4|Wisdom 2:4]] [[BDB#Syr|ᵑ6]] [[Eccl.13.26|Eccl 13:26]] HCT [[BDB#Syr|ᵑ6]]), also ***end, extremity***); — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ע‎</span> absolute [[Gen.3.15|Gen 3:15]] +, construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֲקֵב‎</span> [[Gen.25.26|Gen 25:26]], plural construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עִקָבֵי‎</span> [[Song.1.8|Song 1:8]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עִקְּבֵי‎</span> [[Gen.49.17|Gen 49:17]]; [[Judg.5.22|Judg 5:22]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עִקְּבוֺת‎</span> [[Ps.77.20|Ps 77:20]]; [[Ps.89.52|Ps 89:52]], etc.; — 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** ***heel***, of man, [[Gen.25.26|Gen 25:26]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְיָדוֺ אֹחֶזֶת בַּעֲקֵב אָחִיו‎</span>, as object of attack from behind, [[Gen.3.15|Gen 3:15]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְאַתָּה תְּשׁוּפֶנּוּ עָקֵב‎</span>, [[Job.18.9|Job 18:9]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פַּח‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יאֹחֵז בְּע‎</span>, [[Jer.13.22|Jer 13:22]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נֶחְמְסוּ עֲקֵבָ֑יִךְ‎</span> are treated violently, i.e. are rudely exposed (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִגְלוּ שׁוּלַיִךְ‎</span>); as instrument of attack, [[Ps.41.10|Ps 41:10]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִגְדִּיל עָלַי עָ‎</span> hath ***made great the heel against me***, i.e. given me insidiously a great fall (figurative for taken some cruel advantage of me; compare <span class="bdbLangGreek">ὑποσκελίζω</span>); of an animal, [[Gen.49.17|Gen 49:17]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַנּשֵׁח עִקְּבֵי סוּם‎</span>, [[Judg.5.22|Judg 5:22]] 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** ***mark of heel, footprint***, [[Song.1.8|Song 1:8]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎צְאִילָֿח בְּעִקְבֵי הַצּאֹן‎</span>, [[Ps.56.7|Ps 56:7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִשְׁמְרוּ עֲקֵבַי‎</span> they mark my ***footprints***, i.e. watch me insidiously wherever I go [[Ps.89.52|Ps 89:52]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֲשֶׁר‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ֵהרְפוּ עִקְּבוֺת מְשִׁיחֶ֑ךָ‎</span> i.e. followed him mockingly, of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span> (figurative) [[Ps.77.20|Ps 77:20]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עִקְּבוֺתֶיךָ לֹא נוֺדָ֑עוּ‎</span> thy ***footprints*** were not known (the waters closing over them). **c** ***hinder-part, rear*** (of a troop of men), [[Gen.49.19|Gen 49:19]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְהוּא יָגוּב עָקֵב׃‎</span> (read <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֲקֵבָם ׃ אָשֵׁר‎</span>) he will troop on ***their rear***, [[Josh.8.13|Josh 8:13]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֲקֵבָם‎</span> (compare [[BDB#Di|Di]]).
